result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A. SCOTT was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: under the Huber Law, imposed and stayed, to be imposed upon the agent's discretion.
Perform sixty (60) hours of community service work.

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Conviction Sentence to Jail after Revocation of Probation.  Duplicate original delivered to Sheriff and DOC.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant is before the Court for sentencing, his probation having been revoked effective 02-03-15.  
Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for eight (8) months, consecutive to the sentence imposed on Case No. 12 CF 24.  Court costs to be converted to a civil judgment.  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment.  
Minutes.
Sentencing after revocation of probation is set for 03-09-15 at 3:30 p.m.
Judgment of Conviction Sentence Withheld, Probation Ordered.  Duplicate original delivered to DOC.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 05-22-2014 @ 2:30 pm. BR-3.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-25-14 at 1:30 p.m.  Plea date is set for 05-22-14 at 2:30 p.m.  
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.

Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements of Defendant; Motion to Suppress Statements of Defendant.
Notice of Motion; Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover letter.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 03-31-14 at 10:30 a.m.  
Minutes.
Joseph Pozorski III, through Public Defender.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess THC - 2nd offense.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-24-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, that he maintain absolute sobriety and that he have no contact with James Henrickson, Michael Gadzinski, Damian Danforth and Nathan Henrickson.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
